defs: = ಬೂರಗ.
= ಬೂರಗಬಂಕ.
a kind of tree.
= ಬೂರ್ಜ್ವಾ¹.
= ಬೂರ್ಜ್ವಾ².
of or characteristic of a bourgeois or the bourgeoisie; middle-class; buorgeois.
narrowly contented with one's own accomplishments, beliefs, morality, etc. bourgeois; smug.
the middle class in any society.
a man belonging to this class.
a man who is narrowly contented with his own accomplishments, beliefs, morality, etc.
a thick, soft woollen blanket; a thick felt.
the physical structure of human beings; the body.
(dial.) the part of the body between the ribs and the hips;the waist.
= ಬೂಲ.
= ಬೂಮ.
the earth.
(fig.) useless; of no use.
a downy or furry growth on the surface of organic matter, caused by fungi, esp. in the presence of dampness or decay; mold.
ಬೂಷ್ಟು ಹಿಡಿ būṣṭu hiḍi to have a downy or furry gorwth on one's surface; to be affected by fungus; to become moldy; 2. (fig.) to lose sharpness of mine due to inactivity.
the partly ground husk of wheat or other grain, separated from flour meal by sifting; bran.
food materials; provision.
(fig.) a thing that serves no purpose hence, is useless.
that which lacks genuines or is false.
(rightly, ಭೂಷಣ) anything used for decorating or which suits properly; an ornament.
= ಬೂಸ.
the plant Justicia diffusa (var. hediotidifolia) of Acanthaceae family.
a group of people; a multitude; an assemblage.
a heap of things piled together.
a song sung in chorus by a group of people.
of heaven; belonging to gods; celestial; heavenly.
a god; a deity.
the wish-yielding tree of heaven.
the state of belonging to heaven.
the condition, fact or quality of being a god or deity.
Nārada, the sage of the heaven.
a tower-like structure for growing holy basil, usu. in front of the house.
a similar structure constructed as a monument where saints of some sects are buried.
a similar structure raised in the name of such a saint, elsewhere.
(mus.) a musical mode derived from the main mode Kharaharapriya, in Karnāṭaka system.
placed beneath a tower-like structure (after death), treated as holy.
a saint that is dead and in the place where he is burred, a tower-like structure is raised.
= ಬೃಂದಾವನಸಾರಂಗ.
a man living amidst or being in the group of his relatives.
a thing that is very beautiful.
an eminent man.
the basil plant Ocimum sanctum of Lamiaceae family; the holy basil.
the loud deep sound, made by an elephant.
to utter a loud deep sound, like an elephant.
(an elephant) to make such a sound.
a series of musical phrase of great beauty sung orplayed in higher speed, in Hindūstāni system.
a seat for sages to sit on.
= ಬೃಹನ್ನಳೆ.
that which is characterised by largeness, giganticness.
a large sized vīṇe.
the plant Solanum indicum of Solanaceae family; wild brinjal plant.
its fruit; wild brinjal.
a loose, unsewn cloth used to cover the shoulders.
speech; the sound uttered (by human beings).
any of the four vedas.
(pros.) a metre having nine syllables in each line.
(phil.) the Supreme Being.
to make larger or very big; to enlarge.
very large.
that which is characterised by largeness (in size, area, extent, quantity, number, strength, etc.).
the quality or fact of being dense, thickly populated with.
one of the important upaniṣads, the philosophical works of India.
fire.
the sun.
Viṣṇu.
the plant Ricinus communis of Euphorbiaceae family.
its oil-yielding seed.
= ಬೃಹನ್ನಳೆ.
the form of Arjuna, when he was to live in-cognito.
a man lacking manliness.
= ಬೃಹಸ್ಪತಿವಾರ.
the preceptor of gods.
name of one of the thirty two smřtikāras, the writers of Hindu religious codes.
a school of Indian philosophy, that denies the existence of god and the reliability of vedas.
the fifth day of the week; Thursday.
(math.) the symbol for the cardinal number two; 2.
the rear part of the human body, extending from the neck to the lower end of the spine; the back.
the rear or hinder part of anything; rear portion.
(only in comp.) warm; hot.
the ridge where two sloping roofs meet.
a burning mass of material; fire.
the condition or quality of being hot; heat; hotness.

ಬೆಂಕಿ ಉಗುಳು benki uguḷu to emit fire or hot materials (as a volcano); 2. to display one's wrath; ಬೆಂಕಿ ಕಾರು benki kāru = ಬೆಂಕಿ ಉಗುಳು; ಬೆಂಕಿ ಕೋಳಿ benki kōḷi the largest, most powerful, swift-running bird (Struthio camelus) of Africa and South West Asia, the only member of its order (Struthioniformes), that has long neck and very long legs; ಬೆಂಕಿ ತೋರಿಸು benki tōrisu to set fire to; ಬೆಂಕಿ ಬೀಳು benki bīḷu (fir) to catch something and start burning; ಬೆಂಕಿಯಾಗು benkiyagu to become wrathful; to become intensely angry; ಬೆಂಕಿ ಹತ್ತು benki hattu (fire) to catch something and start burning; ಬೆಂಕಿ ಹಾಕು benki hāku = ಬೆಂಕಿ ಹಚ್ಚು; ಬೆಂಕಿ ಹಚ್ಚಿಸು benki haccisu to set fire to; 2. to cause to set fire to; ಬೆಂಕಿಗೆ ಜ್ವರ ಬರುವ ಮಾತು benkige jvara baruva mātu a saying something about something which can never happen; an unnatural statement; ಬೆಂಕಿ ಹಚ್ಚು benki haccu to set fire to.
the thin piece of wood, cardboard, etc. of a match; a match stick.
the plant Orobanche cernua (var. desertorum) of Orobanchaceae family.
the plant Triumfetta of rotundifolia of Tiliaceae family.

to cause to follow, go behind (another or others).
to cause to run away.
the rear portion of the human body; the back.
the events leading up to something; background.
a long, broad blade with a round handle, used to row a boat; an oar.

the sun, whose rays are hot.
rays of heat; hot rays (as of the sun).
a reddish variety of oligoclase feldspar, used as a gem, having a red and bright-yellow play of colour.
a nearly level stretch of sand beside a sea; a beach.

a burnt earthenware.

a protecting of a person (as by an escort); escorting.

baked or boiled bean or corn.

hump of the back (of a hunchbacked person).
to obstruct or avoid a running away (as of a person running away from a battlefield).

to support; to provide with help for another's sustenance, to cope with the situation, etc.
to run behind another (as to catch); to chase.
the rear wall (of a building).

a kind of bird.
a kind of plant.

a small pond.
a condiment used as a food savoury or appetiser.
the quality of having very little weight (when compared to volume); lightness.
anything that is very light.
the soft, spongy tissue in the centre of certain plant stems; pith.
that which is lacking vitality or spirit; an insipid, sapless thing.
a kind of sweet dish.

the sweet, fleshy fruit of the date palm, having a large, hard seed; date.
the tree Plecospermum spinosum of Moraceae family.
the tree Scleropyrum wallichianum of Santalaceae family.
to lose the active strength or force; to become very weak and hence, useless.
to cause lose the active strength or force; to make very weak and hence, useless.

the soul of a dead woman, imagined as wandering among or haunting living men; a femal ghost.

ಬೆಕ್ಕಿನ ಉಚ್ಚೆ ಗಿಡ bekkina ucce giḍa the plant Lantana camara (var. aculeata) of Verbenaceae family; ಬೆಕ್ಕಿಗೆ ಜ್ವರ ಬರುವ ಮಾತು bekkige jvara baruva mātu = (correctly) ಬೆಂಕಿಗೆ ಜ್ವರ ಬರುವ ಮಾತು (see under ಬೆಂಕಿ); ಬೆಕ್ಕು ಕಣ್ಮುಚ್ಚಿಕೊಂಡು ಹಾಲು ಕುಡಿದಂತೆ bekku kaṇmuccikoṇḍu hālu kuḍidante a simile to express that the doer of wrong things does not know that others are watching him or her; 'you dance in a net and think that no body sees you'; ಬೆಕ್ಕಿನ ಕಿಂಡಿ bekkina kiṇḍi (rightly, beḷakina kiṇḍi) an opening in the wall for light; ಬೆಕ್ಕಿಗೆ ಗಂಟೆ ಕಟ್ಟು bekkige gaṇṭe kaṭṭu to attempt at a dangerous undertaking for the welfare of others; ಬೆಕ್ಕಿನ ಹೆಜ್ಜೆ bekkina hejje a walking without making any sound; a stealthy walk; 2. the plant Ipomoea cairica ( = I. palmata) of Convolvulaceae family; ಬೆಕ್ಕಿಗೆ ಚೆಲ್ಲಾಟ, ಇಲಿಗೆ ಪ್ರಾಣ ಸಂಕಟ bekkige cellāṭa, ilige prāṇa sankaṭa the pleasures of the might are the tears of the poor; ಬೆಕ್ಕಿನ ತರುಡಿನ ಗಿಡ bekkina taruḍina giḍa the plant Crotalaria calycina of Papilionaceae family; ಬೆಕ್ಕಿನ ಹೆಜ್ಜೆ ಬಳ್ಳಿ bekkina hejje baḷḷi the plant Boerhaavia chinensis ( = B. repanda) of Nyctaginaceae family; ಬೆಕ್ಕಿನ ತಲೆ ಗಿಡ bekkina tale giḍa the plant Sida veronicaefolia of Malvaceae family.
the eyes of a human being resembling the eye of a cat.

quickness; swiftness.

to tremble; to shiver.

ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಕುರಿವೇಲು beṭṭada kurivēlu the plant Anisochilus dysophylloides of Lamiceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಕುತ್ತಿ beṭṭada kutti the tree Melochia umbellata of Sterculiaceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಕಮ್ಮಗಗ್ಗರೆ beṭṭada kamma gaggare the plant Wendlandia thyrsoidea ( = W. notoniana) of Rubiaceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಕನ್ನೆಸೊಪ್ಪು beṭṭada kanne soppu the plant Cyanotis cristata of Commelinaceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಕಣಿಗಲು beṭṭada kaṇigalu the tree Dillenia racteata of Dilleniaceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಅರಳಿ beṭṭada arḷi the ficus tree, Ficus arnottiana of Moraceae family; wild peepul; ಬೆಟ್ಟಕ್ಕೆ ಕಲ್ಲು ಹೊರು beṭṭakke kallu horu to take a thing where it is in plenty; to waste one's efforts; to carry coals to New Castle; ಬೆಟ್ಟ ಕಡಿ beṭṭa kaḍi (sarc.) to do a very important or strenuous work; ಬೆಟ್ಟ ಅಗೆದು ಇಲಿ ಹಿಡಿ beṭṭa agedu ili hiḍi to employ great force to achieve little; to go out a hawking for butterflies; to bring forth a mouse for a mountain in labour; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಕುಪ್ಪಿ beṭṭada kuppi the plant Laggera alata of Asteraceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಪರಂಗಿ beṭṭada parangi the tree Carica candamarcensis of Caricaceae family; 2. its fruit; mountain papaya; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಹಸಿರುಗೋಣಿ beṭṭada hasiru gōṇi the tree Dalbergia lanceolaria of Papilionaceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಬೇವು beṭṭada bēvu the large sized, deciduous tree Melia dubia of Meliaceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಹುಣಿಸೆ beṭṭada huṇise the tree Garcinia xanthochymus ( = G. pictoria, = G. tinctoria) of Guttiferae family; Mysore gamboge tree; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ದವನ beṭṭada davana the plant Conyza stricta of Asteraceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಗೋನು beṭṭada gōnu the tree Aleurites triloba of Euphorbiaceae family; varnish tree; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಭಂಗಿಸೊಪ್ಪು beṭṭada bhangi soppu the foul-smelling, henbane plant Hyoscyamus muticus of Solanaceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಬೆಂಡು beṭṭada beṇḍu the plant Abutilon polyandrum of Malvaceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಹುರುಳಿ beṭṭada huruḷi the plant Mundulia sericea ( = M. suberosa) of Papiionaceae family; ಬೆಟ್ಟದ ಸುವಾಸಿನಿ ಹುಲ್ಲು beṭṭada suvāsini hullu the grass Fimbrystylis argentea of Cyperaceae family.
